title.value: High-Throughput and Energy-Efficient VLSI Architecture for Ordered Reliability Bits GRAND
title.justification: The title explicitly mentions the focus on VLSI Architecture for Ordered Reliability Bits GRAND (ORBGRAND).
title.quote: High-Throughput and Energy-Efficient VLSI Architecture for Ordered Reliability Bits GRAND

extractions.description: The paper presents a VLSI architecture for ORBGRAND, a soft-input variant of the GRAND decoding technique. It focuses on high-throughput and energy-efficient design suitable for parallel hardware implementation, comparing its performance to existing decoders for short-length and high-rate channel codes used in applications like 5G.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical evaluations and comparisons of various decoding performances and implementation results for VLSI architecture.
type.quote: The numerical simulation results presented in this work are based on BPSK modulation over an AWGN channel. The ORBGRAND and SGRAND soft-input decoders outperform the hard-input GRANDAB variant in decoding performance.

name.justification: The paper primarily deals with VLSI design for error-correcting codes, specifically focusing on the ORBGRAND algorithm.
name.quote: This work reports the first hardware architecture for ORBGRAND, which achieves an average throughput of up to 42.5 Gbps for a code length of 128 at a target FER of 10−7.

name.justification: A significant aspect of the paper involves improving decoding performance for error-correcting codes.
name.quote: Ultra-reliable low-latency communication (URLLC), a major 5G New-Radio use case, is the key enabler for applications with strict reliability and latency requirements. These applications necessitate the use of short-length and high-rate channel codes.

name.justification: The implementation and performance of the ORBGRAND's hardware architecture is a core part of the paper.
name.quote: This work reports the first hardware architecture for ORBGRAND, which achieves an average throughput of up to 42.5 Gbps for a code length of 128 at a target FER of 10−7.

name.justification: ORBGRAND is the main focus of the architectural design and evaluation presented in the paper.
name.quote: This work reports the first hardware architecture for ORBGRAND, which achieves an average throughput of up to 42.5 Gbps for a code length of 128 at a target FER of 10−7.

is_contributed.justification: The paper specifically develops and tests a VLSI architecture for ORBGRAND, thus contributing it.
is_contributed.quote: This work reports the first hardware architecture for ORBGRAND.

is_executed.justification: The VLSI implementation is tested and results are provided to demonstrate the decoding performance of ORBGRAND.
is_executed.quote: The numerical simulation results presented in this work are based on BPSK modulation over an AWGN channel.

is_compared.justification: ORBGRAND's performance is compared with other decoders like GRANDAB and Fast-DSCF.
is_compared.quote: When compared to the GRANDAB, a hard-input variant of GRAND, the proposed architecture enhances decoding performance by at least 2 dB.

referenced_paper_title.value: Ordered reliability bits guessing random additive noise decoding
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper details the ORBGRAND algorithm, which is the focus of the architecture implemented herein.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Ordered Reliability Bits GRAND (ORBGRAND) [24] and Soft GRAND (SGRAND) [25] are soft-input variants.
